results.title: The Child in the middle
results.creator_credit: Gerard Schaefer, Merrill S. Brody and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts
results.brief_description: Underlines the importance of co-operation by parents and teachers in reaching understanding of children’s problems. In a dramatised example (based on an actual case), Martha causes concern to her teacher when she withdraws from school work and school contacts. The teacher discovers that Martha is throwing away the lunch cut by her grandmother, who also figures oddly in Martha’s free expression art work. Discussion with the parents and the headmistress clears the way for Martha’s readjustment to school life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerard Schaefer, Merrill S. Brody and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts

results.title: Child guidance clinic [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Allen Stark and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Narrator Neil Leroy drops in at the Child Adjustment Services center for the study and treatment of the emotionally disturbed child set up by the Toronto Board of Education. Here, psychologists, social workers and psychiatrists, with the cooperation of parents and teachers, are learning how to deal with children’s emotional problems and to help them develop into healthy, happy adults. Through the story of young Nick, we see how early diagnosis and treatment of a child’s maladjustment can change him into a normal, outgoing youngster.

results.title: Child behaviour = you
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Would you pick up a baby when he cries for attention, or let him yell out his little lungs? This cartoon film for parents poses many such questions that confront a mother during the course of her day. Made with the counsel of child specialists, it provides a perceptive guide to understanding what motivates both good and problem behavior in children from infancy to adolescence, and how to draw out the best.

results.title: Chik's great adventure
results.brief_description: The story of Scouting in Malaya. Chik’s “great adventure” began when he joined the Boy Scouts because scouting gave him adventure, companionship, healthy activity and an opportunity for service in his community. The film provides useful information on the aims and objects of the Scout Movement in Malaya.

results.title: Un Chien andalou
results.brief_description: A surrealistic film using symbolic objects and settings designed by Salvador Dali. The film was a collaboration between Bunuel and Dali over 3 days and shot in 2 weeks. A series of seemingly unrelated images are unified by their power to shock. The famed opening sequence was left out some releases by censors. Enthusiastically received by Paris surrealists, the film saw Bunuel and Dali being recognised by their peers, and it still enjoys its innovative arthouse status. Censorship restriction: Suitable only for adults.

results.title: Chicago: midland metropolis
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the physical and social characteristics of a metropolitan region as exemplified by Chicago. Shows how the people live and work, explains why the Chicago region became a major urban area, and examines some of the critical problems of urban development and the efforts of city planners to solve them.

results.title: Chemistry of soapless detergents
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell, George Seager, De La Chevre Films and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Explains the molecular reaction between water and soapless detergent; molecules; research on the process of synthetization from petrol hydrocarbons. Laboratory demonstration of the production of Alkylbenzene sulphonate basis for a whole range of soapless detergent products for domestic use. Large scale production methods are also shown.

results.title: Chemistry for sixth forms: catalysis
results.creator_credit: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: The term “catalysis” and its importance in industrial processes; homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis; catalytic cracking of petroleum; Faraday’s theory on the cause of surface catalysis; Sabatier-Senderens process using nickel as a catalyst in hydrogenation of vegetable oils; effect of poisons on surface catalysis; effect of manganese dioxide on hydrogen peroxide.

results.title: Chemistry and a changing world
results.brief_description: This film directs the student’s attention to the significance of chemistry in the modern world. It traces the steps leading up to the reproduction of electric furnace phosphorus. In showing the work of research chemists and chemical engineers who work from an original idea until it reaches its final form in the shape of a finished product, the film also provides information which may be of value in vocational guidance.

results.title: Chemical properties of water
results.brief_description: An explanation of the chemical properties of water in terms of the polar nature of the water molecule. Demonstrates chemical reactions of water with metals, metal oxides, non-metal oxides, and salts; shows how water, as a solvent, promotes other chemical reactions.
